title: Connecting Rod - Installation

body.body: Warning Connecting rods PB1 PJ1 PV
For connecting rods fitted with M8 fixings, the connecting rod, big end cap, bearing shell and connecting rod bolts must be replaced if removed.
Reuse of the connecting rods, big end caps, bearing shell and connecting rod bolts will lead to severe engine damage.
For connecting rods fitted with M9 bolts, the connecting rod bolts must be replaced and, if required, the bearing shell.
Premature failure of the connecting rods and big end caps will lead to premature engine failure, loss of motorcycle control and an accident.

Failure to use new gudgeon pin circlips could allow the pin to detach from the piston. This could seize the engine resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit a new circlip to the inside of the piston. Make sure the circlip is correctly located in the piston groove.
Lubricate the connecting rod small-end and gudgeon pin with clean engine oil.
Align the piston with the connecting rod, make sure the triangular mark on the piston crown is facing towards the front of the engine.
Insert the gudgeon pin into the piston and push it fully into position.
Secure the gudgeon pin in position with the remaining new circlip. Make sure the circlip is correctly located in the piston groove.
